name: Flipnote Studio 3D Animation
summary: Learn about .KWZ files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Flipnote Studio 3D allows users to create stereoscopic 3D animations that can be exported in .GIF or .AVI format. It's available in Japanese, North American, and European versions. All versions of Flipnote Studio 3D save animations to 3DS users' SD cards as KWZ files. Users can also export animations made in the original Flipnote Studio app as KWZ files, using the Flipnote Studio 3D online service.

The North American version of Flipnote Studio 3D saves KWZ files to the ~/​JKZE sub-directory. The Japanese version saves KWZ files to the ~/​JKZJ sub-directory; the European version saves them to the ~/​JKZP sub-directory.

description: A KWZ file is a 3D animation created by Flipnote Studio 3D, a free animation app available for the Nintendo 3DS. It consists of several frames that contain three separate layers of artwork, and it also typically includes audio. KWZ files are most often stored on Nintendo 3DS SD cards, in a sub-directory of the /​private/​Nintendo 3DS/​app folder.

instructions: In addition to being able to open and play KWZ files in Flipnote Studio 3D, you can open them in the web-based Flipnote Player.
